/>
V.ii.1.A.2.d
.
Definition:        Probative Value
Evidence has
probative value
if it
makes a matter material to the determination more or less likely, and
has sufficient weight, either by itself or in combination with other evidence, to persuade the decision maker about a fact.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section A - Principles of Reviewing and Weighing Evidence
citation: Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section A
